p: Geranyl acetate has anti-inflammatory [ 189], antifungal [ 189], and antimicrobial properties [ 190]. It is a very weak skin sensitizer [ 167]. It is neither toxic nor carcinogenic [ 8]. It was not mutagenic in the Ames test [ 191], and had no genotoxic effect [ 192]. The acute oral LD 50 of geranyl acetate is 6.33 g/kg in rats [ 183].
